definition: to be present/to be on the scene
(located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
variant of 場|场[chang2]
variant of 場|场[chang3]

sentences.english: But the alibi did not hold up long.
sentences.chinese: 但是，不在场证明没坚持多久。

sentences.english: Many of those present felt this atavistic fear.
sentences.chinese: 在场的那些人中，很多都感到这种隔代遗传的恐惧。

sentences.english: Bao-chai seemed interested in the fact that Bao-yu was there.
sentences.chinese: 宝钗似乎对宝玉当时在场这件事更感兴趣。

sentences.english: Some of them are here this evening, and a few will even join us onstage.
sentences.chinese: 他们有些今晚也在场，有几位更会上台与大家见面。

sentences.english: She gets very skittish when her boy - friend is around.
sentences.chinese: 她男朋友在场时，她就显得格外轻佻。
他的发言冲犯了在场的所有人。

sentences.english: I found a person who watched with him, and was present at his burial.
sentences.chinese: 我找到一个一直陪着他的人，葬礼的时候也在场。

sentences.english: Daniel Wong gave a smile – a sophisticate smilethat inspired the reporters.
sentences.chinese: 黄博士脸上露出的一丝深沉的微笑启迪了在场记者。

sentences.english: Missandei and plenty of Dothraki soldiers will also be on hand.
sentences.chinese: 弥桑黛和大批多斯拉克士兵也会在场。

sentences.english: You can ask our administrator here (Antonio Giraudo).
sentences.chinese: 你可以问在场的吉拉乌多。

sentences.english: His plea unimpressed the vast majority of shareholders present.
sentences.chinese: 他的请求未能使在场的大多数股东动心。

sentences.english: The police are suspicious of his alibi because he already has a record.
sentences.chinese: 警方对他不在场的辩解表示怀疑，因为他已有前科。

sentences.english: This excludes several hundred round-table meetings where numerous companies were present.
sentences.chinese: 这还没有包括数百次有多家公司代表在场的圆桌会议。

sentences.english: The audience were greatly impressed and many of them moved to tears.
sentences.chinese: 在场观众深受感染，有人不禁落泪。

sentences.english: You were not by, when I told mamma and the others all about it.
sentences.chinese: 我跟妈妈和别的姐姐们讲的时候，你都不在场。

sentences.english: He even tells all the audiences present in the venue what allures him.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至是告诉了所有在场者，他著迷的是什么。

definition: on stage/to go on stage/to take the field
stadium/playing field for a competition
team member
(of a performer) to come onto the stage to perform/(of an athlete) to enter the arena to compete/(fig.) to enter the scene (e.g. a new product)/(of an examinee etc) to leave the venue
competition (sports etc)/match/CL:場|场[chang3],次[ci4]/to compete
everyone present/the whole audience/across-the-board/unanimously/whole duration (of a competition or match)
to show up/present (at the scene)
to attack/to assault/to go on the offensive/attack/assault/offense (sports)
racetrack/field (for athletics competition)
to dispose of/to spend (money)/to undertake a task
to go on stage/fig. to appear on the scene/used in advertising to mean new product
Paul
tactics
(ball sports) good shot!/nice hit!/well played!

one of a sequence of contests (or subdivisions of a contest) between the same two opponents/round (boxing etc)/rally (tennis etc)/frame (billiards etc)/inning/(tennis, soccer etc) rubber or leg/round (of negotiations)
to defend/to protect (against)
